title: Maybe it won't be as we had imagined, because it will be better
text:
My Rules

If you want to marry me, here's what you'll have to do:
You must learn how to make a perfect chicken-dumpling stew.
And you must sew my holey socks,
And soothe my troubled mind,
And develop the knack for scratching my back,
And keep my shoes spotlessly shined.
And while I rest you must rake up the leaves,
And when it is hailing and snowing
You must shovel the walk ... and be still when I talk,
And -- hey -- where are you going?

(Shel Silverstein)

title: by the glare of stars.
text:
My heart is a message in a bottle. Every night I send it out. Sometimes it is 12:51AM, sometimes 2:32AM, other times 4:30AM. I have an intimate relationship with the night, and when I go out beneath those dark skies I am thankful, no matter how tired I am. The sky is alive with worlds and star systems, circling, cycling, and orbiting. Venus slinks around the edges of the horizon like a shy girl at a school dance, as Orion prowls the ink-black depths of the night with his glimmering belt, and his spear ready to throw. 

Owls carry on conversations deep in the forest and I eavesdrop for a few moments. A whippoorwill chants its cool mantra. The breeze, the scent of night, all of it makes me glad that I am not asleep. The average person sleeps one third of her lifespan. She misses all of this, the great gorgeous inflection of the darkness.

The night is for stargazing and lovemaking. It is the peace and quiet which you have earned after another day of life in a machine gun civilization, an escape managed from the clutches of a needy and insecure society. The night is your sanctuary. The night is where you throw your soul into the wind-torn sky and fly it like a dragon-kite. The cold of a winter night makes your bed a hundred times more comfortable than it was. The solitude of the night makes your lovers arms feel more like home. And the starlight you drink makes your blood glisten. 

In the depths of the night is where you find your secret identity. After the socially acceptable façade has dropped and been left behind, hanging by the mailbox in front of your house, and you are long gone. There is a large piece of your true soul which your friends cannot define, cannot understand. There is a wild spirit within you that they wouldn't be able to explain. They, in their daylight clothes and billboard symbolisms of their status, would be frightened of this you. 

This true piece of your soul is an ancient wild thing, only released from its cage by the glare of stars.

title: There Are No Shortcuts In Life
text:
Someone I loved very much used to remind me often that you can't skip steps in life. 
Eventually you'll need to double back and close the gap.

In your career you have to show up and do the work.

In your active pursuits you need to do the work to build endurance and mentally acuity. 

Both is a commitment that takes time and focus.

If you're doing it right and really going after your goals there isn't a lot of time left at the end of the day to meet anyone new.
Leaving your romantic fate up to random conversations in the aisle of Whole Foods feels a little too passive.

Do you want to do the work to build trust and intimacy to get to know a person?

We both know that there is a path to chemistry and a connection that yields relationship benefits well worth the time investment.

Are you ready?

title: Good Help Is Hard To Find: My Search For an FWB
text:
Its been a really long time since I entertained the idea of having an fwb because its been my experience that my partner gets so much more out of it than me. The inequity was obscene.. so I lost absolutely all interest in sex for too long and am only just now remembering that I'm still human. I don't ever want to be that turned off again (it SUCKS) so I will be significantly more careful in choosing a new friend 

My needs are very simple and my gratitude is notable.

What I need is a single, std-free, plus size friendly buddy who can host within Brooklyn/Manhattan (only, no exceptions, sorry). He is ideally a 20-something to mid-30's at best. And. He is awesome. 

Thats it. And I say this with love. I hope you find what you're looking for but if you fall outside of any of these parameters, we do not have anything to talk about.

I don't find a lot of the talk guys do online attractive at all. We all get it. Guys like sex. We do too. But you're going to have to meet me in the middle. That includes leaving the lame **** pics out of my inbox, forever. Don't be pushy or rude. And be a human being. You hate relationships? Don't talk to me about it. An fwb is not a ruse for a boyfriend. We're adults. As far as I'm concerned the criteria for an fwb and bf is very different but as a girl who wants more Boyfriend Experience and less favor-for-randoms, I'm not interested in listening to how everyone under 30 is so dumb for wanting to be with anyone. I want to be doused with lots affection, to give it in return and to play with someone who isn't weighed down by a chip on his shoulder. 

Just interested in having a truly enjoyable time every time I see you. Fun, carefree fun, with someone who can be trusted. Actual friends, actual benefits. 

Here's to hoping you're out there.

title: Curvy and Herpes
text:
I posted this before as "Curvy and Herpes, what more could you want?" but it seemed to invite people to ridicule my situation, so I tries something different in the title. (then it got flagged. If I'm not your thing that's cool, but I'm real and those std sites are not used much ) Same post though as it is still true:

Let's just cut to the chase: Herpes is either a big deal to you, or not. 
So if you have educated yourself, you know that it is difficult to pass (2-4% chance from woman to man) but I just need to you be cool with it or have it yourself. I've had it a couple years but never had an outbreak, so it isn't on my radar until I have to have the "talk" with someone and it is just not something I want to have to keep doing. Getting it out in the open is much easier. Okay, on to things that actually matter to those of you who got this far. . .
I'm 50 years old, divorced with grown children. I am looking for love /connection /LTR, BUT we all know that starts with friendship. Age range.. Probably above 35.. I've dated most races(I'm white) and really it's all about being similar enough to relate and different enough to be interesting. I love my life and I'm looking for a connection. While I have my act together, I find I am always learning and growing and finding new things I want to try or learn about. Not daily, but I'm an open-minded person. I don't smoke, but I am cool with 420. Also, I am a curvy girl, so if you really only like slim, petite or athletic, you probably should move on.

If you really need a picture of me right away, send yours. If you just ask me for a picture, I'm going to think you never read to the end of my post and are just a con man (yes, that is what we women run into). Please do tell me a little bit about yourself when you reply.

title: ....gets in the way of a charmed life :(
text:
I walk through the cold today, it's not too bad - I have a great coat. I sit on the train, on the padded bottom of my coat and lay my head on the lovely lining of my hood and look out the window while I listen to my favorite Coldplay/Adele/Keith Sweat/Aretha/whoever song, the trees are brown and bare of their leaves, the ponds still, and I marvel at my charmed life. 

I get to the office and again, marvel because, while it may not seem like the greatest job in the world, it's the greatest job for me right now. I am truly blessed to have it.

Then I go home, there's just me right now (I am blessed with 2 awesome daughters). Then It's a bit of an existence, even a drag - I don't like it but this is the card I have been dealt, for right now and the loneliness sucks. Enough to make me forget that I am truly blessed elsewhere.

Anyone else feel that way or something? Please be age appropriate.

Thank you and good luck in your search!

title: 15 Things That Make You Want to Give Up On Dating
text:
Like most things, there are pros and cons to dating. Sometimes it may seem like a necessary evil on the road to finding love (and it is), but that doesn't mean you don't sometimes want to throw your hands up in the air and say, "forget it! I'd rather be single for life." The planning, the getting your hopes up about a new guy, the being disappointed, the feeling like there are no decent guys left in the world, we've all been there. They do say you'll find the One when you stop looking, so maybe it's time we just put that little piece of dating wisdom to the test.

1. Guys who'd rather text forever than make solid plans. What is he waiting for? Does he need a hand written invitation in order to hang out with you in person? Even worse when you take a chance and ask him out, and he still can't seem to commit to anything.

2. When you find out he already has a girlfriend. But we had such a connection, what do you mean he's not single? Why would he flirt with me like that then?!

3. When your friend meets her soul mate after being on OKCupid for literally 24 hours. How is it that you could scour that site for weeks and barely scrape together a couple dates, and she finds the Chris Pratt in the online dating rough without even having a photo up?!

4. When he invites you out and then "forgets" his wallet. Look, we have no problem paying for our half, but when it's clear he had no intention of paying at all, we have to consider sneaking out through the bathroom window, and leaving him to wash dishes to pay off his debt.

5. When his idea of a date is bringing his entire entourage to meet you at a bar at midnight. A date shouldn't involve him making sure his wing man has a shot with one of your friends.

6. When you think it's going well and he freaks out because you left a spare tampon in his bathroom. Or worse, when he accuses you of leaving it there, but it was actually his roommate's girlfriend.

7. The third time you break up with the same person. Somehow it seemed more productive to revive an old relationship than find someone new. You were wrong. Twice. Dating is just too much work.

8. When you can't seem to get past the first date, ever. Even when it seems like the first date was fantastic, somehow planning the second date becomes harder than trying to schedule brunch with Beyonce.

9. The unsolicited dick pic. Once second you were innocently talking about the third season of House of Cards, and the next, there's a dick on your phone.

10. Watching your friend go through a bad breakup. If you start dating someone, there's a pretty good chance that crying mess on the couch eating an entire bag of Smart Food dipped in peanut butter will be you in the foreseeable future.

11. Coffee dates. Unless you're going on dates at 9am, caffeine is ill advised. No one wants to put any effort into first dates anymore, meaning you end up drinking way more lattes than you should be, and every date becomes pretty dull and repetitive.

12. When he looks nothing like his picture. The question is, do you call him on it, or do you force a polite smile, chug that latte, and get out of there asap?

13. When he leaves you with the bill because you didn't want to hook up. This guy doesn't even pretend he forgot his wallet. He just doesn't come back from the bathroom. So that's why he chose the corner booth with no view of the door.

14. Finding out he's a racist, homophobic, pro-life, misogynistic actual crazy person. It's official, there are no nice, normal guys left. You can end the search now.

15. When staying home in your pjs is more appealing than going out. You could go on another date with this guy, or that guy, but why bother? At least your cat doesn't have uncontrollable gas or make you watch UFC. Once you realize the gloriousness of being single, there isn't much short of a millionaire who looks like David Beckham that will convince you to go on a date ever again. At least for now.

title: The Dating Game
text:
Bachelor number one, "If your date told your best friend that she wanted to be picked up in style for an evening at Carnegie Hall which of these forms of conveyance will you choose to arrive at her door?.
A. A Limousine
B. A horse and carriage
C. Your own car, after you've sprung to have it detailed.

Bachelor number two, "Your date is a divorce attorney. What would you do to give her confidence that your first date may in fact, not be your last?
A. You would bring her a lavish, yet tasteful bouquet of flowers.
B. You would arrive to pick her up from her home ten minutes early with a surprise of tickets to a U2
concert in a city 5 hours away, with round trip plane tickets tucked into the envelope 
C. You would buy yourself a new suit, get your hair cut. You want her to know you take care of yourself and you'll be around for a long, long time.

Bachelor number three. "Your date is a well known politician. What kind of evening would you plan to provide her with a boost in the latest polls?"
A. You would make reservations at the finest French restaurant, followed up by an evening at the opening of a new Broadway show. See and be seen is your motto.
B. You would treat her to an evening at the opening show of the newest up and coming visual artist at an exclusive gallery in mid town.
C. You would rent a Lamborghini and drive her to one of the most trendy clubs in town, and give her a chance to let her hair down and dance the night away.

title: Beeep Beeep!!
text:
I'm seeking a single light haired, light eyes professional man based in Manhattan, aged 36-48 who can pass the traffic test (see below). Foodie, not Hipster. No facial hair. J. Crew, not Goth. Valid passport.

I am a dark haired, dark eyes female executive based in Manhattan. Long, straight hair. Glasses. Traveled. Articulate. Funny. Loves cooking, photography & reading. Not a karaoke fan. Nor sake. Nor soju. Love me a Frappacino with lots of whipped cream, though. Let's discuss over dinner. I love seafood & red meat. Whiskey > wine. 

The Traffic Test, exerpted from a larger piece by Tim Urban.

> I enjoy spending time with most of my friends--that's why they're my
> friends. But with certain friends, the time is so high-quality, so
> interesting, and so fun that they pass the Traffic Test.
>
> The Traffic Test is passed when I'm finishing up a hangout with
> someone and one of us is driving the other back home or back to their
> car, and I find myself rooting for traffic. That's how much I'm
> enjoying the time with them.
>
> Passing the Traffic Test says a lot. It means I'm lost in the
> interaction, invigorated by it, and that I'm the complete opposite of
> bored.
>
> To me, almost nothing is more critical in choosing a life partner than
> finding someone who passes the Traffic Test. When there are people in
> your life who do pass the Traffic Test, what a whopping shame it would
> be to spend 95% of the rest of your life with someone who doesn't.
>
> A Traffic Test-passing friendship entails:
>
> A great sense of humor click. No one wants to spend 50 years fake laughing.
> Fun. And the ability to extract fun out of unfun situations--airport
> delays, long drives, errands. Not surprisingly, studies suggest that
> the amount of fun a couple has is a strong predictor for their
> future.6
> A respect for each other's brains and way of thinking. A life partner
> doubles as a career/life therapist, and if you don't respect the way
> someone thinks, you're not going to want to tell them your thoughts on
> work each day, or on anything else interesting that pops into your
> head, because you won't really care that much what they have to say
> about it.
> A decent number of common interests, activities, and
> people-preferences. Otherwise a lot of what makes you 'you' will
> inevitably become a much smaller part of your life, and you and your
> life partner will struggle to find enjoyable ways to spend a free
> Saturday together.
>
> A friendship that passes the Traffic Test gets better and better with
> time, and it has endless room to deepen and grow ever-richer.

text:

That scent is you.

On your knees, deep in the closet of your childhood home. Reaching passed your mother's dress-up, church coat and your daddy's clay dusted, work boots. You reach juuust passed your brother's most treasured toy train, laying haphazardly in all its played with glory, to find your most favorite pair of sneakers, hidden deep inside the closet's bosom. Those well cared for shoes that you've worn long enough to perfectly mold to your graceful, yet still semi-clumsy feet. As you breathe in, you catch just a hint of the peppermint gum hidden within the pocket of your mama's wool coat. Your shoes were kept safe from your sister's greedy hands for just one more day!

Home.

I picture me greeting your gently whiskered cheek with my partially parched lips in a comfort filled, hurried embrace. You hear the shuffle of little feet, giggles, and exasperated warnings not to be late. We're off to their next biggest adventure! We share in one heavenly glazed, long paused expression. With heavy lids, our moment's embrace ends, but not without the silent promise of our own nighttime adventures to come.

Home

title: "There are so many I could take to bed..."
text:
There are so many I could take to bed, So few I'd like to wake to all the while. . . 
And parting in the early morning, smile, 
And wave my hand farewell, and smile, And wait for news from them, and fret. And with so many, I could be just me, 
Drink coffee in the morning, talk, debate. . . 
With whom, I could vacation on the sea, 
In sickness and in health, - as it should be. . . 
Yet, feel no love at all at any rate. . . So few with whom I'd like to share desires! 
Gaze at the sky, with clouds drifting slow, 
And write the words of love upon first snow, 
And always think of only them, and know 
No other bliss to which I could aspire. So few with whom my silence could be shared, 
Who'd understand by gazing at my eyes, 
To whom I'd give my years without a care, 
For whom, I would accept as though prize, 
Whatever punishment, whatever pain to bear. . . And so it goes, one long and common thread -- 
First meetings - carefree, break-ups -- ever mild. . . 
Because there are so many there to take to bed, 
And yet so few to wake to all the while. . . There are so many I could take to bed. . . 
So few with whom I'd wake up feeling closer. . . 
And life -- it takes and weaves us like a thread. . . 
Throws us together, guessing on a saucer. We toss and turn: - jobs. . . daily cares. . . and din. . . 
He who would like to hear must learn to listen. . . 
While on the run, you'll only notice skin. . . 
Slow down a bit. . . and see the soul you're missing. We make our choices with both heart and mind. . . 
At times, afraid to smile at a smile, 
But we reveal our souls to those we find 
Whom we would like to wake to all the while. . .
Please " you age 45-60

title: Good Help Is Hard To Find: My Search For an FWB
text:
Its been a really long time since I entertained the idea of having an fwb because its been my experience that my partner gets so much more out of it than me. The inequity was obscene.. so I lost absolutely all interest in sex for too long and am only just now remembering that I'm still human. I don't ever want to be that turned off again (it SUCKS) so I will be significantly more careful in choosing a new friend 

My needs are very simple and my gratitude is notable.

What I need is a single, std-free, plus size friendly buddy who can host within Brooklyn/Manhattan (only, no exceptions, sorry). He is ideally a 20-something to mid-30's at best. And. He is awesome. 

Thats it. And I say this with love. I hope you find what you're looking for but if you fall outside of any of these parameters, we do not have anything to talk about.

I don't find a lot of the talk guys do online attractive at all. We all get it. Guys like sex. We do too. But you're going to have to meet me in the middle. That includes leaving the lame **** pics out of my inbox, forever. Don't be pushy or rude. And be a human being. You hate relationships? Don't talk to me about it. An fwb is not a ruse for a boyfriend. We're adults. As far as I'm concerned the criteria for an fwb and bf is very different but as a girl who wants more Boyfriend Experience and less favor-for-randoms, I'm not interested in listening to how everyone under 30 is so dumb for wanting to be with anyone. I want to be doused with lots affection, to give it in return and to play with someone who isn't weighed down by a chip on his shoulder. 

Just interested in having a truly enjoyable time every time I see you. Fun, carefree fun, with someone who can be trusted. Actual friends, actual benefits. 

Here's to hoping you're out there.

title: sincerely ISO intellectual bad a** for committed, loving ltr
text:
marfa, texas. mark rothko. mad libs.

david sedaris. pop-up books. bedtime stories. wilco. billowy duvets. tangerine sunsets. cats. animals, in general. calder. starry nights. sapiosexual. lazy sundays.

marina abramovic. npr. the moth series. modern wing at the met. manatees. manta rays. walking barefoot. st. pete, florida (where i'm from). genuinely connecting with someone. sparks. lots of sparks.

being off the grid. sunday morning political shows. movies, more limited release vs. blockbuster. bob mould. aimee mann. nada surf. john mayer. hole. rem. coldplay. radio head. rod stewart. neil young. steely dan. miles davis. berlioz. nina simone.

green apples. tap water. grits. bourbon + ginger ale. lychees. figs. cycling. cold spring. hudson, new york.

marquis de sade. aziz ansari. chuck palahniuk. the symposium. making out. hand holding. pink tulips. purring cats. seashells. candle lit rooms. artichokes. brussel sprouts. deep breathes. head in the clouds. looking up, always.

laughing. cartwheels. spinning into dizziness. cutthroat kitchen. tetris. flavin. pillow forts. my acoustic, nylon-string guitar. ray lamontagne. sol lewitt. storm king.

eclectic. eccentric. electric. introspective. genuine. vulnerable. natural red head. richard serra. dia beacon. istanbul = culture shock. ischia, italy = riding vespas.

fireflies. bull frogs. pixie dust. empathetic. kissing. lots of kissing. cloud watching. hop scotch. love letters. cycling. glasses, sometimes.

listening. whispering. being present. journalism major. fireworks. sparklers. art minor. masters in art restoration / conservation / collection management in progress.

jeans. ponytails. can be ready in 15 min. lobster rolls. mary's fish camp. music + art = bliss.

goofy. freckled. installed 125 of christo's gates in central park. jukebox. record player. thunder storms. brighter than sunshine. love. lust. xo.

title: vegan seeking fellow vegan

Looking for a member of my species who is a compassionate individual, socially & morally evolved, to face extinction unfoldment with.

The carnist guilt and hate is thick, and their sense of right to censor through flagging reinforces my awareness that we truly do have a government that does represent the ACTUAL populace, they personally like to sensor -even in personal ads.

I am 55 divorced no kids...work in the healing field, alternative media-phile, Borzoi lover, vegan. survivor of a dysfuctional family in a dysfunctional society. I go to Adult Children of Alcoholics and Dysfunctional families and found my support group there, love the literature too, have come to the conclusion we all have varying degrees of Stockholm Syndrome....very luck few had a family welcoming and waiting for the person to unfold and emerge, vs the norm...being hammered and molded by the adults in the primary primate tribe into who one ought to be, to the point the sense of self is all but lost....

I love Dr William Tuttles Eloquent interpretation of the situation with humans and the state of animal demise on the planet;

"Women should be protected from anyone's exercise of unrighteous power. . .but then, so should every other living creature."

~ George Eliot
When love is born in our hearts, we want only the best for others, for we directly see them as ourselves. The imprisoning illusion of a fundamentally separate self, struggling against other selves for its own rewards, is transcended, and our life becomes dedicated to bringing peace, joy, and fulfillment to others. This brings us our greatest joy, and is the flowering of the highest form of love, which is compassion.
We must, if this process is actually happening in us, be drawn toward veganism, and it is in no way a limitation on us, but the harmonious fulfillment of our own inner seeing....Dr. William Tuttles

title: Beeep Beeep!!
text:
I'm seeking a single light haired, light eyes professional man based in Manhattan, aged 36-48 who can pass the traffic test (see below). Foodie, not Hipster. No facial hair. J. Crew, not Goth. Valid passport.

I am a dark haired, dark eyes female executive based in Manhattan. Long, straight hair. Glasses. Traveled. Articulate. Funny. Loves cooking, photography & reading. Not a karaoke fan. Nor sake. Nor soju. Love me a Frappacino with lots of whipped cream, though. Let's discuss over dinner. I love seafood & red meat. Whiskey > wine. 

The Traffic Test, exerpted from a larger piece by Tim Urban.

> I enjoy spending time with most of my friends--that's why they're my
> friends. But with certain friends, the time is so high-quality, so
> interesting, and so fun that they pass the Traffic Test.
>
> The Traffic Test is passed when I'm finishing up a hangout with
> someone and one of us is driving the other back home or back to their
> car, and I find myself rooting for traffic. That's how much I'm
> enjoying the time with them.
>
> Passing the Traffic Test says a lot. It means I'm lost in the
> interaction, invigorated by it, and that I'm the complete opposite of
> bored.
>
> To me, almost nothing is more critical in choosing a life partner than
> finding someone who passes the Traffic Test. When there are people in
> your life who do pass the Traffic Test, what a whopping shame it would
> be to spend 95% of the rest of your life with someone who doesn't.
>
> A Traffic Test-passing friendship entails:
>
> A great sense of humor click. No one wants to spend 50 years fake laughing.
> Fun. And the ability to extract fun out of unfun situations--airport
> delays, long drives, errands. Not surprisingly, studies suggest that
> the amount of fun a couple has is a strong predictor for their
> future.6
> A respect for each other's brains and way of thinking. A life partner
> doubles as a career/life therapist, and if you don't respect the way
> someone thinks, you're not going to want to tell them your thoughts on
> work each day, or on anything else interesting that pops into your
> head, because you won't really care that much what they have to say
> about it.
> A decent number of common interests, activities, and
> people-preferences. Otherwise a lot of what makes you 'you' will
> inevitably become a much smaller part of your life, and you and your
> life partner will struggle to find enjoyable ways to spend a free
> Saturday together.
>
> A friendship that passes the Traffic Test gets better and better with
> time, and it has endless room to deepen and grow ever-richer.

title: \\\\\\\\\\\\\Modern Love \\\\\\\\\
text:
Now, admittedly maybe I listen to too many podcasts, or I've seen one too many romantic comedies; but I keep waiting for that big cinematic moment when I find "THE ONE". I also love run-on sentences. 

I'm 25 years old. Not old but caught in that awful phase of watching all my friends get married and have kids. I don't want those things tomorrow or even in a year...but someday I'd love that. 

Craig'slist is a cesspool for the weird, sexual, deranged and also people just trying to sell their lawnmowers. I know this. This ad is pathetic at worst and whimsical at best. 

I love Charles Bukowski and foreign films. I love the smell of sunscreen, and putting milk duds in my popcorn. I love philosophy and critical realism. I love insensitive jokes even though I'm an advocate for equality and social justice. I always put my elbows on the table when I eat and I always need a napkin. I like hearing people compliment one another. I love eating delivery Chinese food on a rainy day. I love laughing so hard that it makes you cry, or crying so hard that it makes you laugh. I think Roseanne is one of the funniest sitcoms that was ever on television. I buy and read too many books at once so I'm always reading two-three at a time. I eat Spaghettios straight out of the can and I have a scar on my thumb from trying to open a can of Spaghettios. 

I'm quiet, but I laugh loudly. I'm opinionated but I speak carefully and with thought. 

I maintain the dream someone will see me and be blown away as if they just had the wind knocked out of them; and I'll feel the same about them.

Nothing serious unless something serious grows -

title: sincerely ISO intellectual bad a** for committed, loving ltr
text:
marfa, texas. mark rothko. mad libs.

david sedaris. pop-up books. bedtime stories. wilco. billowy duvets. tangerine sunsets. cats. animals, in general. calder. starry nights. sapiosexual. lazy sundays.

marina abramovic. npr. the moth series. modern wing at the met. manatees. manta rays. walking barefoot. st. pete, florida (where i'm from). genuinely connecting with someone. sparks. lots of sparks.

being off the grid. sunday morning political shows. movies, more limited release vs. blockbuster. bob mould. aimee mann. nada surf. john mayer. hole. rem. coldplay. radio head. rod stewart. neil young. steely dan. miles davis. berlioz. nina simone.

green apples. tap water. grits. bourbon + ginger ale. lychees. figs. cycling. cold spring. hudson, new york.

marquis de sade. aziz ansari. chuck palahniuk. the symposium. making out. hand holding. pink tulips. purring cats. seashells. candle lit rooms. artichokes. brussel sprouts. deep breathes. head in the clouds. looking up, always.

laughing. cartwheels. spinning into dizziness. cutthroat kitchen. tetris. flavin. pillow forts. my acoustic, nylon-string guitar. ray lamontagne. sol lewitt. storm king.

eclectic. eccentric. electric. introspective. genuine. vulnerable. natural red head. richard serra. dia beacon. istanbul = culture shock. ischia, italy = riding vespas.

fireflies. bull frogs. pixie dust. empathic. kissing. lots of kissing. cloud watching. hop scotch. love letters. cycling. glasses, sometimes.

listening. whispering. being present. journalism major. fireworks. sparklers. art minor. masters in art restoration / conservation / collection management in progress.

jeans. ponytails. can be ready in 15 min. lobster rolls. mary's fish camp. music + art = bliss.

goofy. freckled. installed 125 of christo's gates in central park. jukebox. record player. thunder storms. brighter than sunshine. love. lust. xo.

title: Exposé for Lost Life / No More Valiant Effort
text:
Exposé for Lost Life / No More Valiant Effort

I lit a bonfire at the end of my soul and stood there waiting for it. The inevitable burnout, the life-force fuel gauge at E. Ah, but it would appear that I have reserve tanks, and perhaps multiples of them. This road to hell, so carefully paved with all my good intentions, is a winding one. I remind myself that hell is not the destination, but rather just a place we pass through on the way home. The Venetian blind we slip through when the light pours from the dawn like cream from the pitcher, like data downloading an ancient message from an unknown source. Like my trip-hop heart thump in the Grand Vizier's garden of orchids and hyacinth. Meteors reflected in the eyes of a seventeen year old girl outside of Bucharest and I taste the style and wrap myself in her printed stockings. I am scratched by expensively manicured nails and this is a new age of werewolves and poets.

Deva uses his smile to get under my skin, a subcutaneous sensuality, it gets tangled up with my sublime bass-line and we both fall, head over heels out of heaven, and blazing back down to earth.
This is my goodbye to Oz.

title: Illuminati of Appetite
text:
The kissing game- Are we not more than just a collection of appetites which stampede to the forefront of our consciousness, each in its turn taking the lead, driving our thudding hearts into both the flung wide futures and dead-end streets of our hunger?

Destiny, in its ravenousness, waits to devour us.

You worry about what you should and shouldn't do. You worry about what others in your society would think. But there are a trillion stars in the azure evening sky, and not one of them is worried. They just burn.

And they asked me how I became so immersed in words
Sentences, lines, rhythms. . .
I told them it was a side effect of
Making Love to Librarians
And between quiet aisles of lore
And tomes of dusty civilizations,
Precariously stacked world maps. . .
They taught me penance for mere pennies
With fingers pressed to my red lips,
The sex was in hushed whispers
After which, they taught me to pray.
Pray so hard your heart hurts.
Pray until you bleed.
Pray like a stigmatic would pray, for these prayers are the only things
That can cut through TV drone death tangle, the culture crash,
The stupid insouciance of burning rain forests and PR agents.
And as they punched my library card they whispered
"Pray for us now, and at the time of our death."

And I walk out into evening beneath the cobalt sky,
And under the turn of galaxies
I could still pick up traces of their scent
Perfumed angels and the subtle hint of flowers and heartbreak
Heartache.
I understand about the heartache now. It never seems to want to let go does it?
It sinks into us, and calls our hearts home.
And we sink, slowly, like Atlantis.
With our wishes.
Which seem almost limitless, like the stars in the sky.
Billions of them, and somehow they all seem to hide
Beneath my blanket and when I lay down at night they jump on me.
Pull me
Out to sea
In an undertow of dreams. Take me to a place where my heart
Beats by torchlight.

title: Beeep Beeep!!
text:
I'm seeking a single light haired, light eyes professional man based in Manhattan, aged 36-48 who can pass the traffic test (see below). Foodie, not Hipster. No facial hair. J. Crew, not Goth. Valid passport.

I am a dark haired, dark eyes female executive based in Manhattan. Long, straight hair. Glasses. Traveled. Articulate. Funny. Loves cooking, photography & reading. Not a karaoke fan. Nor sake. Nor soju. Love me a Frappacino with lots of whipped cream, though. Let's discuss over dinner. I love seafood & red meat. Whiskey > wine. 

The Traffic Test, exerpted from a larger piece by Tim Urban.

> I enjoy spending time with most of my friends--that's why they're my
> friends. But with certain friends, the time is so high-quality, so
> interesting, and so fun that they pass the Traffic Test.
>
> The Traffic Test is passed when I'm finishing up a hangout with
> someone and one of us is driving the other back home or back to their
> car, and I find myself rooting for traffic. That's how much I'm
> enjoying the time with them.
>
> Passing the Traffic Test says a lot. It means I'm lost in the
> interaction, invigorated by it, and that I'm the complete opposite of
> bored.
>
> To me, almost nothing is more critical in choosing a life partner than
> finding someone who passes the Traffic Test. When there are people in
> your life who do pass the Traffic Test, what a whopping shame it would
> be to spend 95% of the rest of your life with someone who doesn't.
>
> A Traffic Test-passing friendship entails:
>
> A great sense of humor click. No one wants to spend 50 years fake laughing.
> Fun. And the ability to extract fun out of unfun situations--airport
> delays, long drives, errands. Not surprisingly, studies suggest that
> the amount of fun a couple has is a strong predictor for their
> future.6
> A respect for each other's brains and way of thinking. A life partner
> doubles as a career/life therapist, and if you don't respect the way
> someone thinks, you're not going to want to tell them your thoughts on
> work each day, or on anything else interesting that pops into your
> head, because you won't really care that much what they have to say
> about it.
> A decent number of common interests, activities, and
> people-preferences. Otherwise a lot of what makes you 'you' will
> inevitably become a much smaller part of your life, and you and your
> life partner will struggle to find enjoyable ways to spend a free
> Saturday together.
>
> A friendship that passes the Traffic Test gets better and better with
> time, and it has endless room to deepen and grow ever-richer.

title: Black British BBW Seeking Professional Affluent Single Male
text:
Well here you have it an Afro-British born, BBW, college educated. I have been part of the NYC vast culture for approximately 10+ years now. What brings me here is that I am looking for some winning qualities in a man that I cannot come across in regular day to day setting in NYC. Maybe it's that there isn't enough time in the day for a meeting of 2 beautiful minds.

I am here to say that if you are on CL please do not hesitate to drop me a note, I will have already made some claims that I am looking for something potentially serious, so should that reflect on some of your personal goals in finding that one serious partner please reach out.

Please know the qualities that I seek will go somewhat in the following order: single male, college educated, professional type, affluent, handsome, ages 32-50. Someone who has both intellect, mannerism and has a profound respect for women. I have pretty much lead a very independent life both in London and NYC, my friends are my family, however I am on a journey to change the status quo. My focus up until now was purely my survival, like we all do, work, pay the bills so on and so forth. But that existence eventually becomes tiresome and we look to pair up because that's just the order nature has in mind for us.

Here's what you need to know about me, my unmistakable intelligence and irresistible English accent is usually the winner. As you should and would know that you have to like and want a Big Beautiful Woman, as many guys out there will box you into a specific size, type, height and age. I am 34, not married and have no children. I am so accustomed to my independent life, that I actually would like to meet someone that can take charge and help ease me into a LTR. In other words I am asking for someone with patience and possibly someone who has the same urges to want to move along the lines of marriage and children in the near future.

title: Wonderfully Unexpected
text:
It's A rainy Saturday morning. You made it through the week and you find yourself perusing through these posts. You never expected you would be "the kind" to reply to them, but then you read this one and even though you find it hard to believe that there is a girl out there who gets you, you take a chance and respond because it just might lead to something wonderfully unexpected. Something extraordinary. 

I know what it is like to have a demanding career that keeps you busy Monday-Friday. I also know that work, although it may seem like your whole life, is not. You go to the gym. Have beers with the guys. Hopefully spend time with your family. I get it. Im not looking to take over anyone's world, nor would I want you to be ever present in mine. It would, however, be nice to have a consistent date for dinner, an occasional gym partner, a travel companion, and of course a lover behind closed doors. 

If this strikes a chord with you, I'd love to hear from you. Please be a single, white professional between the ages of 28 and 35. Show you are genuinely interested by writing more than a few words. Full sentences and proper grammar do not go unnoticed. Only serious messages will receive responses. 

Oh! One more thing, it would be great if you live in CT along the southern coastline, somewhere between Milford and Stamford.

title: Golden Years
text:
I've been single for several years after a very long marriage. I survived my divorce by burying myself in my career and raising my children. I now find myself at a crossroad and I am frightened once again. My children have families of their own and my ex remarried. I have many decisions to make, when to retire is at top of the list. Financially, what BabyBoomer can afford to retire and live a comfortable life. I was never concerned about retirement I always thought I'd be sharing the expenses with a partner. 

The gentlemen I've dated are old and act old....they are content rocking in their chairs waiting for death to come knocking at their door! I"D RATHER BE SINGLE THE REST OF MY LIFE THEN CONTINUE TO DATE THESE GUYS! I apologize if that comes across harsh but it's the truth. I have way too much living to do. 

Walking along the beach holding hands, hugging, sweet kisses, traveling, theater, museums, were my plans for my Golden Years. 

I will continue to dream and hope to find my Prince Charming...who may be a bit older but very wise!

Life is good but it would be better to share it with someone. Let's enjoy my country home and your Manhattan apartment.

If you are in a similar situation I would love to hear back from you.
Searching for a SWM, 58-65, intelligent, non-smoker,

title: Let's meet and see where it goes.
text:
I read the ads on craigslist and they are pretty much all about what a person wants. They want a long term relationship. They want a marriage. They want a family. It's all about the what, but not really the who. 

It would be nice to have a long term relationship, but I don't necessarily want that right now. I haven't met a person that I want to spend most of my time with. You know what? That's not true. I meet people that I'd love to see regularly, but people in NY are fickle. And I'm looking for something magical. Not a mediocre and basic relationship that results in marriage and babies. 

I guess I'm looking for a partner, ultimately. Someone who will support me in my decisions and see me as an equal. I'm not looking to complete someone or for someone to complete me. I'm just looking for someone to enjoy fun times with. One day at a time. 

We can discuss this more over pizza and drinks or whatever. But I want to meet tonight and I'm craving a slice of pizza with ranch on it. Random. I know. 

Anyway, I know the most important thing about me to some people is how I look. And I'm pretty damn sexy, so you don't have to worry about that. I'm a little tall, a little slim, and a little edgy. And I have photos to share. Brown eyes. Dark hair. A few piercings. No tattoos.

I just ask that you are not very traditional. I don't like that. I like men in their thirties. Not twenties. Not fourties. And I prefer a taller gentleman because I am not a short woman. You should also be pretty fucking awesome. Awesome, to me, is being down for new experiences, even if it is outside of your comfort zone. If you are someone who says "no" often, I'm def not interested. 

Let's get this ball rolling. One day at a time.

title: An actual relationship
text:
Is dating even a thing anymore? I'm so tired of all of the coffee dates that turn into nothing and hookups that never call again. I want a boyfriend. I want someone who wants to spend time with me. On weekends, our days off. Someone who brings me lunch at work. Someone who wants to come see me. Not someone that I should have to beg to spend time with in the first place. Someone who wants to come over and watch a movie or play video games, order pizza, whatever. Someone who lets me come over his place, cook him dinner, and stay the night. Someone who wants to go out every once in awhile and do cool things. The Science Center for a Way Late Play Date, the museum for a new exhibit, art crawl, farmers market, or maybe even downtown just for fun. That's how a relationship is supposed to work, right? Texting, calling, spending time with one another. Is that so bad?

Please do not bother if you are only going to send me a single sentence of "how are you" or anything of the like. I have put a lot of thought into my post. title: Dating LTR/Romance Needed
text:
I have really bad scars from an accident I had as a child. **The photo is a picture of an ex model turned burnsurvivor named Turia Pitt. ** I read about her story and how her relationship was able to pull through the trauma of her accident. Although it's a bit of a reach for me, I am hopeful that despite the absence of the right guy, its possible for me too. 

So coupled with the outcome of my injury and growing up in a conservative household, I consider myself a bit of a late bloomer. The scars on my face are my biggest regret because as you can imagine people's stares aren't always kind. So in anticipation of eye contact, I tend to look away. Trust me, I'm working on it and it's getting better with time. 

My personality is adaptable. In many instances like work and school, I'm a social butterfly and a relatively confident person. But when it comes to social environments where I'm meeting people who aren't familiar with me and especially where dating or flirting happens, I tend to flounder and not know what to do... While this seems like a venting session, I'd like to hope there's someone who's out there who can relate and or want to get to know me, despite the obvious challenges I'm getting over.

I have made some strides in the dating area, I guess. The other day I met someone I was chatting with from tinder and it went fine. We met once after a few days and then another time after a few weeks of talking. I just don't think it's going anywhere because subtle things indicated that he didn't respect me or my time... I'll leave it at that. But for some reason a few days after the second meet up we just stopped checking in. Despite that upset, I did learn through that experience that in spite of feeling singled out and unlovable; I realized how many, if not all people sometimes feel that way. 

Simply put by a bar buddy I met at the Continental Dinner while waiting forty-five minutes for my date to arrive (oops, I said I wouldn't get into that), the buddy said we all have scars and experience trauma. Its just that some of your scars show on the outside. As simple and obvious as that may seem, it meant the world to me to feel that even for a second, I wasn't as different as my appearance and interactions lead me to sometimes feel and believe. Needless to say, I'm working on myself but am certainly not a push over (so you preying wolf, stay away!) 

If you're interested in getting to know someone like myself and maybe hangout, shoot me a message by telling me about yourself and attach a picture of yourself. Here's some of the things I hope you're like:

Friendly, Respectful
Single, No kids, Never married
Educated, Employed, Ambitious
27-35 age **
5'9 height or taller *
Stylish/Well groomed

More About Me----> I'll send you my picture once you send yours. I'm an African American educated female, 5'10, slim build, dark toned skin, and I have a great smile. I know it may seem like I'm asking for a lot but hey why limit your hearts desire. Prayers up. :) Thats it for now...

title: sincerely ISO intellectual bad a** for committed, loving ltr
text:
marfa, texas. mark rothko. mad libs.

david sedaris. pop-up books. bedtime stories. wilco. billowy duvets. tangerine sunsets. cats. animals, in general. calder. starry nights. sapiosexual. lazy sundays.

marina abramovic. npr. the moth series. modern wing at the met. manatees. manta rays. walking barefoot. st. pete, florida (where i'm from). genuinely connecting with someone. sparks. lots of sparks.

being off the grid. sunday morning political shows. movies, more limited release vs. blockbuster. bob mould. aimee mann. nada surf. john mayer. hole. rem. coldplay. radio head. rod stewart. neil young. steely dan. miles davis. berlioz. nina simone.

green apples. tap water. grits. bourbon + ginger ale. lychees. figs. cycling. cold spring. hudson, new york.

marquis de sade. aziz ansari. chuck palahniuk. the symposium. making out. hand holding. pink tulips. purring cats. seashells. candle lit rooms. artichokes. brussel sprouts. deep breathes. head in the clouds. looking up, always.

laughing. cartwheels. spinning into dizziness. cutthroat kitchen. tetris. flavin. pillow forts. my acoustic, nylon-string guitar. ray lamontagne. sol lewitt. storm king.

eclectic. eccentric. electric. introspective. genuine. vulnerable. natural red head. richard serra. dia beacon. istanbul = culture shock. ischia, italy = riding vespas.

fireflies. bull frogs. pixie dust. empathic. kissing. lots of kissing. cloud watching. hop scotch. love letters. cycling. glasses, sometimes.

listening. whispering. being present. journalism major. fireworks. sparklers. art minor. masters in art restoration / conservation / collection management in progress.

jeans. ponytails. can be ready in 15 min. lobster rolls. mary's fish camp. music + art = bliss.

goofy. freckled. installed 125 of christo's gates in central park. jukebox. record player. thunder storms. brighter than sunshine. love. lust. xo.

title: Something more deep and meaningful
text:
I have found that sexual desire functions are quite interesting. It seems it functions as a dual reciprocity of the awareness of oneself as flesh. One sees the subjectivity of the other and in turn also recognizes one's own subjectivity in themselves. Together bathing in the blissful yet temporary joy. You become close to becoming a whole being, of perfect mind and bodily harmony, no longer haunted by the nothingness and lack of existence and lack of pleasure in "normal life".

The moment of orgasm shatters this and returns each partner again back to their own fractured forms, acutely aware of their defined lack, like a racer at the end of a race wanting to race again, like a skier at the foot of the mountain, like a basketball player at the end of the final game, like a sexual beast at the end of orgasm. Always wanting more and to do it again. We are chasing orgasmic moments in life because inside ourselves we often refuse to question our own existence. Should we stop chasing these moments? Can the sexual beast inside humanity even be stopped? What if we embrace it and still embrace something more meaningful and powerfully "deeper" (pun intended) ??? Hmmmmmm

title: Starcrush Lipstick
text:

There is a certain taste to the Aegean Sea during the third week of spring.
There is a current which pulls, as the tides shift, off the coast of Argentina.
There is an ache in the heart of a woman working second shift
For a corporation which doesn't even know her name.
There a flower which blooms in the sub-Saharan grasslands whose leaves taste
Like soft jasmine powder melting on your tongue as they poison you
To eternal dreamless sleep.
There is an old man in Mongolia who can see your past lives.
There is an end in sight but the blind do not know it.
There is an Olmec inscription still buried in the Yucatan jungles, unread, unheard.
There is an echo of an ancient explosion haunting the empty depths of interstellar void.
There is a child listening to his parents bitter, hostile arguements.
There is a dog sleeping with its eyes open.

title: Voluptuous Garden
text:
Voluptuous Everything /Garden of the Curved Goddess

Listen to me. I want you to hear this. I want to tell you this, because most likely no one else has told you lately. If you are reading this, then I am talking to you. I'm not referring to someone else, even if you might at first think that I am, I am talking to you. To you.
I want you to know that you are beautiful, valuable and precious. I want you to know that you are important. Maybe you used to know that, but these days no one is reminding you of it much. Well, you are. You are a good person. You are a vital part of this world. I am not lying to you, nor am I trying to get anything from you. I have no subversive reason to tell you this. I only tell you because it is true. And because I fear you might have forgotten.
My friend Corrine wrote once that we begin our lives as a miracle and slowly forget that we still are. I want you to understand that. It doesn't matter what you think of me, my writing, my pictures. If you believe nothing else, believe this because it is true -- You are still a miracle. And this little bit of time you have here is precious. And you deserve to be happy, you really do. No, it's not "all about you", and I'm not talking about pure hedonism. But you should be happy with yourself, and you should be good to yourself. You should do something thrilling with your life. Something you are passionate about.
It doesn't matter what mistakes you've made in the past. It doesn't matter what happened long ago. It doesn't matter if you're fucked up or damaged.
You're still beautiful. And you're still magic.
And the reason you're here, is because the universe wants you here.
I didn't write this for someone else. I wrote this for you.
I love you. And if I can love you. . . Then you should love you too.
Believe in yourself. . . Tonight. . ..and tomorrow. . ..are all yours.

title: Prometheus Rechained
text:
The nightingale told the truth somewhere in the summer night all those years ago. Its song resonating deep within, and I shivered despite the July warmth in which the fireflies soaked around me; a Mid Western beauty queen.

Fates come and go, but I have thus far been an escape artist. I have extracted myself from some pretty extreme situations. On my best days I've been Houdini in the tank, wrapped in heavy chains and yet still managing to find freedom, to find a path out of the danger. Like I said. . . these are my best days.
Other days. . .. I am Knievel hitting the ramp at Caesars Palace, trying to jump that Samsaric fountain. All speed and daring and optimism,my blonde hair flying high into the air beneath a clean American sun. But the landing. . .something goes wrong with the front wheel. The trajectory was off. You can watch the video still today, in slow motion even, if you want. How quickly control can be lost. . .the bone-shattering impact. . .the month-long coma which follows. Learning to walk again. . . And eventually, learning to jump again.
It becomes a sadhana of wounds. The earth is my confessional.

title: Men, I could really use your help
text:
Men, I have a serious matter I could really use your opinion & advice.

I was seriously dating a guy for 10 months and we had talks of a marriage, children, & family one day. I was brimming with hopes of a good future. Although people tell me I am truly beautiful, he was the only person I dated in my 20s because I was holding out for the right guy. I was a virgin who sung in church choir for 8 years. I also come from a traditional culture & family where you can only be intimate with your husband.

The tidbits of the wedding planning started. Then one day, unexpectedly, he disappeared without a trace. No replies to my texts or calls. I was devasted, felt jilted, disrespected, & most of all ruined. It was extremely painful, the worst. I didn't know what to tell friends and family. It felt like losing a fiancé that you will never see again this lifetime. I was inconsolable and stopped working. It was an open wound that increased each day & left me with a million questions. Words can not describe what this does to a woman.

He said I was the love if his life and that he wanted to be with me always.

I'm 29, he's 31. He was a 4.0 student, great althlete, high school quarterback, MBA, tall, good looking, workaholic in finance.

One of the saddest parts for me is now I no longer sing in choir. In fact I no longer go to church. Every time I drive to church, I can't seem to enter, walk to the side, cry to myself, then walk back to my car and drive away. I lost the spirit and heart to attend church services.

Now 3.5 months have passed, & out of the blue, I get a text from him " Hi there". I once would have given so much to get a response, but now it's only received with sadness & painful memories. Where did he go for 3.5 months? I haven't replied back to him.

I contemplated replying back to ask all the questions I had, but I realize it doesn't change what happened. I decided to just ignore him altogether.

I believe I paid for the crimes of another woman, his selfish ex girlfriend. A few months before meeting me, he ended a 2 year relationship because he caught her cheating. It was only later that I realized I was probably the person during his recovery period, possibly a rebound, mean time girl.

Perhaps he left to be with another woman & when it didn't work out, he comes back to me as a fallback because he thinks I will be there for him.

I have enough self respect to know that I can never walk this path with him again. I just don't know how to proceed. It's still difficult to let go of someone who promised you forever.

I don't know how to heal a crime of the soul... one that is so intense & deep. Some men don't realize that when they do this, women suffer tremendously... especially one who held onto innocence and ideals for nearly 3 decades.

Last year I was full of aspirations, singing joyfully in church choir with my virtue. Now I feel broken in every way - physically, emotionally, spiritually.

There are many situations why people get married for convenience; it does not have to be about love. There are situations of gay men getting married because they don't want anyone to know that they are gay. title: Looking For A Co-Parent
text:
This is a bit of an unconventional proposition, but I'll put it out there in the hopes that it resonates with someone in a similar position. Nothing beats a try but a failure. Here we go.....

Getting straight to the point, I would like to have a baby. I believe I have all the makings to be a great mom. The only thing missing is an equally devoted gentleman to share in this co-parenting journey with me. Which is why I am going out on a limb and posting this advertisement.

The twist to this scenario is that I do not currently reside in New York. I am residing in the Midwest until after the new year when I will be returning back to New York as a fulltime resident. I am not looking to wait until next year to start this process. I would like to meet someone in or close to the New York area and take a moment to get to know them, and if things go as planned, begin our journey as early as June. I have thoughts about how everything would unfold and would be happy to share them with any legitimate prospect. It definitely can be done.

Rather than starting by outlining what I am looking for, it perhaps, is more important to state upfront what I am NOT looking for. I don't want to waste anyone's time.

WHAT I AM NOT LOOKING FOR: Casual bulls, breeders, sperm donors, or pregnancy risk fetish seekers. Married or attached men. Persons who have no interest in being part of the child's life or providing financial support towards their upbringing. Men who want "Father Unknown" listed on the child's birth certificate. Someone wanting to impregnate multiple women. I am looking for an exclusive arrangement. I'm not interested in being part of a harem of "baby mothers."

I would, ideally, like to partner with someone open to the possibility of us developing a personal relationship and raising the child together as a single unit. With that said, I know that may not be a feasible scenario. No pressure. I would be equally at home with us just being good friends (without any personal relationship or commitment) and happily co-parenting our child together. The most important focus is the child and providing it with a loving and stable environment.

WHAT I AM LOOKING FOR: A man who wants to take an active role in the child's life . Attractive . Single . Straight . Quality genetic stock . Open to your race . Preferably with no kids (certainly not a deal breaker, if you do) Healthy . Average to fit shape . DDF . 35 - 50 years of age . Atleast 5'10 or above . Has their own place . Financially, emotionally, mentally, spiritually grounded . Has a sincere heart and commitment to being a good parent.

ABOUT ME: Attractive . Woman of Color . Straight . Curvy . Early 40's . DDF . Mature . Educated . Employed . Has own car and place .Cultured . Kind with a giving heart . Great personality . Easy to get to know and be around . Amazing family and support . Quality genetic stock . Mentally, emotionally & spiritually rooted . Come with an overabundance of love and desire to be a mom and provide a child with a wonderful and advantaged life. 

It would also be awesome if you had the desire to assist with helping to nurse or suckle when I produce milk. This, again, is ideal, not a requirement. 

If this unconventional proposition is of interest, email me and let's discuss our thoughts in greater detail. In your reply, kindly share some details about yourself, situation and what you are looking for. I will NOT reply to one word or one line responses. I've tried to be detailed as possible in describing who I am and the arrangement I hope to have. Please show the same courtesy.

I will take the time to acknowledge gentlemen who bother to write out a well thought out response, whether there is a connection or not. 

Please include a clear pic of yourself with your reply. No pic, no reply

title: by the glare
text:
My heart is a message in a bottle. Every night I send it out. Sometimes it is 12:51AM, sometimes 2:32AM, other times 4:30AM. I have an intimate relationship with the night, and when I go out beneath those dark skies I am thankful, no matter how tired I am. The sky is alive with worlds and star systems, circling, cycling, and orbiting. Venus slinks around the edges of the horizon like a shy girl at a school dance, as Orion prowls the ink-black depths of the night with his glimmering belt, and his spear ready to throw.

Owls carry on conversations deep in the forest and I eavesdrop for a few moments. A whippoorwill chants its cool mantra. The breeze, the scent of night, all of it makes me glad that I am not asleep. The average person sleeps one third of her lifespan. She misses all of this, the great gorgeous inflection of the darkness.

The night is for stargazing and lovemaking. It is the peace and quiet which you have earned after another day of life in a machine gun civilization, an escape managed from the clutches of a needy and insecure society. The night is your sanctuary. The night is where you throw your soul into the wind-torn sky and fly it like a dragon-kite. The cold of a winter night makes your bed a hundred times more comfortable than it was. The solitude of the night makes your lovers arms feel more like home. And the starlight you drink makes your blood glisten.

In the depths of the night is where you find your secret identity. After the socially acceptable façade has dropped and been left behind, hanging by the mailbox in front of your house, and you are long gone. There is a large piece of your true soul which your friends cannot define, cannot understand. There is a wild spirit within you that they wouldn't be able to explain. They, in their daylight clothes and billboard symbolisms of their status, would be frightened of this you.

This true piece of your soul is an ancient wild thing, only released from its cage by the glare of stars.

title: Kiss Me...
text:
Luxurious and slow, unbridled in its passion, the kiss is the key that unlocks the door to both hearts and bodies. Hesitant at first, brushing lightly, a little dart of the tongue. Eyes closed, behind darkness of lids We are suddenly sucked into an unholy vortex, hearts lurching into our throats, the electricity of the moment running up and down our bodies sending every nerve through timeless, passionate bliss. We slow down to taste the sweet nectar, forgetting where we are. Dizziness reminds us we have to breathe, reluctantly pulling our lips apart.
